page.title: 03Holford Combe
page.content: Much of the charm of this wooded combe surrounded by moorland has its origin in history. The{oaks}were coppiced every forty years for{bark {for The Tannery _}now known as the {Combe House Hotel,}while the{wood}was burned on the hills for{charcoal}which was made into{gunpowder.} The{Orchards of Combe House Hotel } were originally{Enclsures.}When a severe economic depression caused a food shortage small areas of the {Quantock Common}were enclosed by the people to grow crops. The{Tanyards}27 foot{water wheel is still part of Combe House. After the Tanyard closed it drove a{dynamo} which supplied{light}to Combe House It also powered a stone cracker in the quarry,a chaff-cutter and circular saws and continued to work until 1953
